Let me tell you my story...........I sent a Katana to Moses B. for 
polishi=
ng. This blade is suriage and the Mei that is present 
is 'Bizen (no) Kuni =
Ju Osafune'(cut). This blade has paper from 
Inami Hakusui. He papered it t=
o a Shinto Sukesada. From my studies 
and the opinion of others, only Koto =
blades were signed as above 
(Bizen Kuni Ju Osafune (name)). 

Moses and I =
decided to submit it to the NY NTHK Shinsa to learn 
their opinion. I haven=
't heard from Moses yet but am very curious. 
Did they even give it paper? =
As soon as I hear, I will let you know 
the out come.




--- In nihontostu=
dy@yahoogroups.com, "Mark Conneran" <conneranm@...> 
wrote:

h to make a few observations regarding the Jersey City show. 
I came up 
> =
to the show with a friend, hoping to take in a lecture or two. 
Obviously a=
 
> lot of work went into it. A few thoughts, for what it's worth, as 
> co=
nstructive criticism. We went to the taikai and skipped the 
shinsa 
> thin=
king that the latter would only be for those submitting swords 
to be 
> ev=
aluated. The taikai was worthwhile for the budo demonstrations 
alone. The =

> swords in the sword display, however, were not labeled and we 
were, of =

> course, curious to know what it was we were viewing. 
>  
> We are both =
members of JSS/US but haven't attended any of the NY 
club 
> meetings and =
really have little sword knowledge. As such I'm 
enormously 
> impressed by=
 the knowledge of the members of this list. But from 
the 
> comments I've =
seen here earlier discussing the need to 
attract "new blood", 
> I think a=
ctivities such as the "introduction to sword handling" 
lecture 
> might pe=
rhaps be expanded and publicized. Again, for what it's 
worth.
> 
> Mark Co=
nneran

 be a serious opportunity for learning. I hope that people 
can

rom a shinsa. I also encourage everyone to ask questions.

o few people who picked up their pieces and did not 
ask  
> for an explana=
tion. Next time, if there is one for you, ask the 
guy  
> taking your mone=
y to call me over. I will be happy, or not, to  
> explain anything you wan=
t to know. That is why we are doing a 
shinsa.  
> Not to make you feel bad=
, but to try and share some knowledge 
with  
> you. If I was hard on Ted, =
I am sorry. If Ted would like to 
contact  
> me off line, I would be happy=
 to help him understand his results. 
We  
> are doing another shinsa in Ch=
icago next April. Please use this  
> opportunity to learn. Also, if anyone=
 would like to volunteer to 
help

you can share in the process.
